module.p: càit where is a question word (interrogative adverb).

section.p: The complement of càit is introduced by the interrogative particle an.

module.p:
Some basic examples –
Càit a bheil an gille beag an diugh? Tha e anns an sgoil.
Where is the little boy today? He is in the school. td. 14
Càit a bheil an cat? Tha e aig an teine.
Where is the cat? It is by the fire. td. 14
A bheil an cù aig an teine? Chan eil. Càit a bheil e? Tha e anns an achadh an diugh.
Is the dog by the fire. No, it isn’t. Where is it? It is in the field today. td. 14
Càit a bheil Màiri an diugh? Tha i anns a’ bhaile.
Where is Mary today? She is in the town. td. 20

Some progressive examples –
Càit a bheil Seumas ag obair? Tha e trang ag obair anns an achadh.
Where is James working? He is busy working in the field. td. 15 [227–8]
Càit a bheil i a’ cluich? Tha i a’ cluich air an làr.
Where is she playing? She is playing on the floor. td. 15
Càit a bheil thu a’ fuireach? Tha mi a’ fuireach anns a’ chlachan.
Where do you live? I live in the village. td. 20

Some basic examples –
Có bha ag iasgach an diugh? Bha Alasdair. Càit an robh Alasdair ag iasgach? Bha e ag iasgach air an abhainn.
Who was fishing today? Alexander was. Where was Alexander fishing? He was fishing on the river. td. 20

section.p: càit can be used as the root of a direct question.

Some examples –
Càit a bheil an gual? Air an teine.
Where is the coal? On the fire. td. 15 [227]
A bheil Seònaid anns an sgoil an diugh? Chan eil. Càit a bheil i? Tha i anns an taigh.
Is Janet in the school today? No, she isn’t. Where is she? She is in the house. td. 14
Càit a bheil Màiri an diugh? Tha i anns a’ bhaile.
Where is Mary today? She is in the town. td. 20
Càit a bheil an leabhar? Tha an leabhar air a’ bhòrd.
Where is the book? The book is on the table. td. 20
Có bha ag iasgach an diugh? Bha Alasdair. Càit an robh Alasdair ag iasgach? Bha e ag iasgach air an abhainn.
Who was fishing today? Alexander was. Where was Alexander fishing? He was fishing on the river. td. 20
